org.ecoinformatics.seek.ecogrid

Class EcoGridServicesController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ecoinformatics.seek.ecogrid.EcoGridServicesController

  • public class EcoGridServicesController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will control the current service user want to search: user can add, remove and update the service list
    Author:
    leinfelder (modified from jing tao's version)

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static EcoGridServicesController getInstance()
        Method to get an object from this singleton class

      • init

        protected void init()

      • removeService

        public void removeService(EcoGridService service)
        Remove a given service from current query service list. The key for removing is endpoint. If endpoint is same, we think they are same service
        Parameters:
        service - EcoGridService

      • addService

        public void addService(EcoGridService service)
                throws InvalidEcoGridServiceException
        Add a service to service list. If new service has same endpoints to service already in current. Then we will compare document type array and add new document type into service If the serviceType is not a in our list, it will throw an exception
        Parameters:
        service - EcoGridService
        Throws:
        InvalidEcoGridServiceException

      • clearServicesList

        public void clearServicesList()

                   throws InvalidEcoGridServiceException
        Method to update a existed EcoGridService
        Parameters:
        service - EcoGridService
        Throws:
        InvalidEcoGridServiceException

      • getServicesList

        public java.util.Vector getServicesList()
        Method to get the full service list vector
        Returns:
        Vector all services in the controller

      • setServicesList

        public void setServicesList(java.util.Vector serviceList)

      • mergeServicesList

        public void mergeServicesList(java.util.Vector newServices)
        Rather than completely overwriting the existing services, this method allows new services to be merged with the existing ones. Services with overlapping endpoints are updated to use the other attributes of the new service. If a service (endpoint) is not found in the current list, the new service is added
        Parameters:
        newServices - list of new EcoGridServices to merge with the existing services
        Throws:
        InvalidEcoGridServiceException - cascades up from the add() and update() methods used by this method

      • authenticateForService

        public java.lang.String authenticateForService(EcoGridService service)
        Provides an authentication credential for the given service object (if possible) Note that there may not be adequate information in the EcoGridServicesController to support authentication for every service. Additionally, authentication is not applicable for all EcoGridService types
        Parameters:
        service - an any given EcoGridService that might need authentication credentials to use This service must be part of a service group that has registered a valid authentication service that will provide the credential for use by other service types
        Returns:
        an authentication credential (string) to be used by the service given in parameter

      • getServiceDomain

        public Domain getServiceDomain(EcoGridService service)
        Parameters:
        service -

      • getService

        public EcoGridService getService(java.lang.String endPoint)
        Used for tying together related services Finds the EcoGridService for a given endpoint
        Parameters:
        endPoint - the URL of the service
        Returns:
        service object (EcoGridService) that shares the same endPoint

      • getService

        public EcoGridService getService(java.lang.String serviceGroup,
                                 java.lang.String serviceType)
        Finds the EcoGridService for a given serviceGroup/serviceType pairing
        Parameters:
        serviceGroup - the name of the group of services to search within
        serviceType - the type of service to locate
        Returns:
        service that meets the input parameters

      • getServiceGroupList

        public java.util.Vector getServiceGroupList(java.lang.String serviceGroup)
        Finds a list of services for a given serviceGroup name
        Parameters:
        serviceGroup - the name of the group of services to search within
        Returns:
        list of EcoGridService objects for the given serviceGroup

      • getServicesList

        public java.util.Vector getServicesList(java.lang.String serviceType)
        Finds a list of services for a given serviceType name this is a convenience method for the more general form that takes a full list of types
        Parameters:
        serviceType - the name of the serviceType of services to search within
        Returns:
        list of EcoGridService objects for the given serviceType

      • getServicesList

        public java.util.Vector getServicesList(java.util.Vector serviceTypeList)
        Finds a list of services with serviceTypes in the given type list
        Parameters:
        serviceTypeList - list of serviceTypes to match on
        Returns:
        list of EcoGridService objects for the given serviceTypes

      • getQueryServicesList

        public java.util.Vector getQueryServicesList()
        Finds a list of query services this is a convenience method for the more general form that takes a full list of types
        Returns:
        list of EcoGridService objects for querying

      • getSelectedServicesList

        public java.util.Vector getSelectedServicesList()
        Method to get selected service with selected document types from service list vector. If a service selected, but without any selected documents, this service couldn't be in this vector

        Returns:
